content:
Good morning @simulacrum :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes: I have more bootstrap nonsense to blather about if you don't mind listening.

While fixing https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/95369, I found that there are many different places in bootstrap/test.rs hardcoding things like

    if !builder.fail_fast {
        cmd.arg("--no-fail-fast");
    }

My initial thought was "oh I'll just add a common_test_args(&mut cargo) function they all call". Unfortunately, it turns out they're all adding different flags, in such a way I don't know whether it's unintentional or not. Here is a sample: https://www.toptal.com/developers/hastebin/evasofudec.rust

Should I take the union of all the flags? Leave out RUSTFLAGS for some of the tests because it changes the behavior? Just leave it all as is? not sure ...
well, I'll go with the union of all the flags for now, and I'm happy to change it if you see something in review that shouldn't be there :)
also, I'm sorry all these reviews are landing on you :sweat_smile: let me know if there's someone else I should ask to review bootstrap changes
